qas.question: What are bounds volumes of comics called in America?
What is the name given to Japanese comics volumes?
What type of work is the word novel generally geared towards?
What term can mean a non-fiction piece of a collection of short pieces?
What are bounds volumes of newspapers called in America?
What is the name not given to Japanese comics volumes?
What type of play is the word novel generally geared towards?
What term can mean a fiction piece of a collection of short pieces?
What term can mean a non-fiction piece of a collection of long pieces?

context: Book-length comics take different forms in different cultures. European comics albums are most commonly printed in A4-size colour volumes. In English-speaking countries, bound volumes of comics are called <a0_0><a3_0><b4_0>graphic novels<b4_0/><a3_0/><a0_0/> and are available in various formats. Despite incorporating the term "novel"—a term normally associated with <a2_0><b6_0>fiction<b6_0/><a2_0/>—"<b7_0><b8_0>graphic novel<b8_0/><b7_0/>" also refers to non-fiction and collections of short works. Japanese comics are collected in volumes called <a1_0><b5_0>tankōbon<b5_0/><a1_0/> following magazine serialization.
